Ivanka Trump Bela Ayahnya Pakai Kalimat Bapak Pendiri AS
01 Nov 2019, 08:30 by Non Koresponden , Eka Yudha Saputra
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Ivanka Trump, putri dan penasihat senior Presiden Donald Trump, membela ayahnya yang terancam dimakzulkan dengan kata-kata dari bapak pendiri Amerika Serikat, Thomas Jefferson.
Dilaporkan bahwa DPR AS telah mengesahkan resolusi yang diajukan Demokrat, untuk memberikan otorisasi penyelidikan pemakzulan Trump. Resolusi adalah langkah awal untuk masuk ke fase penyelidikan selanjutnya, sekaligus menepis kritikan Republik dan Gedung Putih, bahwa penyelidikan pemakzulan tidak adil dan tidak transparan.
Tak lama setelah pengesahan resolusi, Ivanka Trump menulis kalimat dari Thomas Jefferson di Twitter pada Kamis.
"'... dikelilingi oleh musuh dan mata-mata yang menangkap dan memutarbalikkan setiap kata (yang) jatuh dari bibirku atau mengalir dari penaku, dan menemukan di mana fakta gagal. - Refleksi Thomas Jefferson di Washington, D.C. dalam surat kepada putrinya, Martha. Beberapa hal tidak pernah berubah, ayah!" kicau Ivanka Trump, seperti dikutip dari CNN, 1 November 2019.
Donald Trump juga merespons resolusi DPR di Twitter. "Perburuan Penyihir Terbesar Dalam Sejarah Amerika!" tulisnya.
Pada Kamis, 232 anggota DPR, termasuk mantan anggota Partai Republik yang meninggalkan partai awal tahun ini, memberikan suara untuk meresmikan penyelidikan dan 196 anggota, termasuk dua Demokrat, memberikan suara menentang formalisasi.



Adapun kalimat Thomas Jefferson yang dikutip Ivanka Trump berasal dari surat Februari 1801 yang ditulis Jefferson kepada putrinya ketika dia menjabat wakil presiden, dan Kongres masih menentukan apakah Jefferson atau Aaron Burr akan menjabat sebagai presiden. Pemungutan suara di Kongres memantapkan kepresidenan Jefferson kurang dari sebulan kemudian.
Jefferson, dalam surat itu, tampaknya mengutip ketegangan antara dirinya dan musuh politiknya. Dia kemungkinan merujuk pada persaingannya dengan Federalis dan pers sekutunya, yang digambarkan oleh Center of Virginia University of Virginia "telah mencapai tingkat permusuhan pribadi yang jarang disamakan dalam politik Amerika" pada tahun 1800.
Secara khusus, Federalis mengkritik agamanya, yang menyimpang dari agama Kristen, dan menurut Universitas Virginia, menggambarkannya "sebagai seorang Jacobin yang tak Bertuhan yang akan melepaskan kekuatan teror berdarah ke tanah itu."
Meskipun kutipan tersebut mungkin mencerminkan sifat persaingan pahit yang sudah berlangsung lama di Washington, serangan terhadap Thomas Jefferson tidak berkaitan dengan penyelidikan pemakzulan.

Ivanka Trump Defends His Father Using Sentences Mr. Founder of the US
01 Nov 2019, 08:30 by Non Correspondent, Eka Yudha Saputra
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Ivanka Trump, daughter and senior adviser to President Donald Trump, defended his father who was threatened with impeachment with words from the founding father of the United States, Thomas Jefferson.
It was reported that the US House of Representatives had passed a resolution submitted by the Democrats, to authorize Trump's impeachment investigation. The resolution is the first step to enter into the next phase of the investigation, while dismissing criticism from the Republic and the White House, that the investigation of impeachment is unfair and not transparent.
Shortly after passing the resolution, Ivanka Trump wrote a sentence from Thomas Jefferson on Twitter on Thursday.
"'... surrounded by enemies and spies who capture and twist every word (which) falls from my lips or flows from my pen, and discovers where facts fail. - Reflections on Thomas Jefferson in Washington, DC in a letter to his daughter, Martha Some things never change, father! " chirping Ivanka Trump, as quoted by CNN, November 1, 2019.
Donald Trump also responded to the House's resolution on Twitter. "The Biggest Witch Hunt in American History!" he wrote.
On Thursday, 232 House members, including former Republicans who left the party earlier this year, voted to formalize the inquiry and 196 members, including two Democrats, voted against formalization.



The Thomas Jefferson sentence quoted by Ivanka Trump comes from a February 1801 letter that Jefferson wrote to his daughter when he was vice president, and Congress still determines whether Jefferson or Aaron Burr will serve as president. A vote in Congress stabilized Jefferson's presidency less than a month later.
Jefferson, in the letter, seemed to cite the tension between himself and his political enemies. He probably referred to his rivalry with the Federalists and their allied press, described by the Center of Virginia University of Virginia "having reached a level of personal animosity that was rarely equated in American politics" in 1800.
In particular, the Federalists criticized his religion, which deviated from Christianity, and according to the University of Virginia, described him "as a Godless Jacobin who would release the bloody force of terror to the land."
Although the quote may reflect the long-standing nature of bitter competition in Washington, the attack on Thomas Jefferson has nothing to do with the investigation of impeachment.
